bibl.title: Journal article, Journal of the American Medical Association, September 26, 1925

div1.p: Officials Attend Dr. H.R. Carter Rites

div1.head: Journal article, Journal of the American Medical Association, September 26, 1925
div1.opener:
Wednesday
THE EVENING STAR, W
Sept 16/25
div1.p:
OFFICIALS ATTEND
DR. H. R. CARTER RITES

Former Assistant Surgeon General
of U. S. P. H. S. to Be Laid
to Rest Today.

Funeral services for Dr. Henry R.
Carter, former assistant surgeon
general of the United States Public
Health Service, who died Monday,
were conducted in St. Margaret's
Episcopal Church at 10 o'clock today.
Archdeacon Sterling Claiborne of
Sewanee, Tenn., and Rev. Dr. Herbert
Scott Smith, rector of St. Mar-
garet's, officiated. Interment will be
in Ashland, Va., late this afternoon.

Gen. Hugh S. Cumming. United
States Public Health Service: Asst.
Surg. Gen. B. J. Lloyd, United States
Public Health Service; W. S. Terri-
berry, assistant surgeon general,
United States Public Health Service,
retired; Public Health Surgeon Jo-
seph Goldberger, George W. McCoy,
W. H. Frost and J. G. Townsend, Dr.
John Minor, Brig. Gen. Robert E.
Noble. U. S. A., retired; Dr. D. P.
Penhallow, Dr. J. E. F. Thorps and
Dr. J. P. Leake.

Active pallbearers were surgeons
of the Public Health Service: R. R.
Sayers. W. T. Harrison, R. E. Dyer,
E. C. Ernest, J. H. Linson and R. C.
Williams.

A French woman is winning success
in restoring old laces and tapestry
by needlework.

A weather and shipping bulletin is
to be broadcast from English coast
